pageTitle: Cross River Tram consultation results published
description: The consultation sought the views of local residents and businesses on various options for the proposed 16.5km route.Independent researchers IPSOS MORI carried out the consultation and over 5,000 people and organisations responded to give their

title.title: Cross River Tram consultation results published

texts: Transport for London today published the results of a public consultation on route options for the proposed Cross River Tram.
The Cross River Tram would provide an important public transport link
The consultation sought the views of local residents and businesses on various options for the proposed 16.5km route.
Independent researchers IPSOS MORI carried out the consultation and over 5,000 people and organisations responded to give their views.
The results show strong support for the tram. Positive responses were received from all the borough councils that the tram would pass through: Camden, Westminster, Lambeth and Southwark.
A decision on the preferred route will follow a technical review and assessment of whether funding will be available.

The review and further feasibility work will look at potential passenger numbers, improvements in journey times, a review of depot and staged implementation options, traffic and environmental impacts and the views on route options expressed by the public and stakeholders.

Ken Livingstone, Mayor of London said: "The Cross River Tram would provide an important public transport link to provide a fast and reliable transport link from rapidly developing residential areas such as Elephant & Castle and King's Cross, to around one million jobs in central London."
Luke Albanese, Project Director for Cross River Tram said: "This report will help us to develop our proposals.
"A decision on a recommended preferred route will follow a technical assessment of all the different options."

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["The proposed Cross River Tram will be a high quality public transport link, running on-street between Euston and Waterloo, with branches to Camden Town and King's Cross in the north, and Brixton and Peckham in the south","The public consultation into route options for Cross River Tram ran from November 2006 to February 2007.  The report on the consultation, undertaken by IPSOS MORI, is available on Transport for London's website at: \u003ca href=\"http://www.tfl.gov.uk/crt\"\u003ewww.tfl.gov.uk/crt\u003c/a\u003e ","The report presents the results of the public consultation on route options for the Cross River Tram. Cross River Tram is a large scheme, with a long route that covers four boroughs so the route was divided into five sections to facilitate ease of comment during the public consultation."]}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Section 1:  Euston - Waterloo:    one route alignment","Section 2:  Euston - King's Cross:   two route options","Section 3:  Euston - Camden Town:  two route options","Section 4:  Waterloo - Oval/Brixton:\u003cbr /\u003eWaterloo - Oval:   two route options\u003cbr /\u003eOval - Brixton:   two route options\u003cbr /\u003eBrixton town centre:   two route options","Section 5:  Waterloo - Peckham:\u003cbr /\u003eWaterloo - Peckham:  two route options\u003cbr /\u003ePeckham town centre:  two route options\u003cbr /\u003ePeckham town centre terminus: two route options"]}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Section 1:  Euston to Waterloo (no route choice)\u003cbr /\u003e77 per cent of respondents gave positive views and\u003cbr /\u003e11 per cent voiced negative opinions about this route choice\u003cbr /\u003e12 per cent of respondents expressed spontaneous support for a tram on this route\u003cbr /\u003ethree per cent of respondents were of the view that the Cross River Tram is not necessary","Section 2:  Euston to King's Cross\u003cbr /\u003eRoute 1 - via Mornington Crescent and Crowndale Road\u003cbr /\u003eRoute 2 - via Somerstown\u003cbr /\u003e55 per cent support option 2\u003cbr /\u003e35 per cent prefer route option 1\u003cbr /\u003enine per cent have no preference at all and one per cent gave both routes as equal preference","Section 3:  Euston to Camden Town\u003cbr /\u003eOption 1 - both northbound and southbound trams running along Camden High Street\u003cbr /\u003eOption 2 - northbound trams running along Camden High Street, southbound trams running along Bayham Street\u003cbr /\u003e65 per cent prefer option 1\u003cbr /\u003e25 per cent prefer route option 2\u003cbr /\u003e10 per cent had no preference","Section 4:  Waterloo to Oval/Brixton\u003cbr /\u003eWaterloo - Oval\u003cbr /\u003eOption 1 - via Waterloo Road, Elephant \u0026 Castle and Kennington Park Road\u003cbr /\u003eOption 2 - via Kennington Road\u003cbr /\u003e52 per cent prefer route option 1\u003cbr /\u003e36 per cent prefer option 2\u003cbr /\u003e11 per cent expressed no preference and one per cent gave both routes equal first choice","Oval - Brixton\u003cbr /\u003eOption 1 - via Clapham Road and Stockwell Road\u003cbr /\u003eOption 2 - via Brixton Road\u003cbr /\u003e47 per cent prefer route option 2\u003cbr /\u003e34 per cent prefer option 1\u003cbr /\u003e18 per cent have no route preference and 1% gave both options as equal first choice","Brixton town centre\u003cbr /\u003eOption 1 - via Brixton Road and Effra Road, looping around St Michael's Church onto Brixton Hill\u003cbr /\u003eOption 2 - via Canterbury Crescent to terminate in Pope's Road\u003cbr /\u003e53 per cent preferred option 1.\u003cbr /\u003e27 per cent of respondents have no preference on the route chosen\u003cbr /\u003e19 per cent of respondents support option 2","Section 5:  Waterloo to Peckham\u003cbr /\u003eWaterloo - Peckham\u003cbr /\u003eOption 1 - via Burgess Park and Chandler Way\u003cbr /\u003eOption 2 - via Wells Way and Southampton Way\u003cbr /\u003e51 per cent 1,265 prefer route option 1\u003cbr /\u003e37 per cent of respondents prefer route option 2\u003cbr /\u003e11 per cent have no preference on this section of the route","Peckham town centre\u003cbr /\u003eOption 1 - via Peckham Square\u003cbr /\u003eOption 2 - via Peckham Hill Street\u003cbr /\u003e51 per cent prefer route option 2\u003cbr /\u003e26 per cent prefer the choice of route option 1\u003cbr /\u003e22 per cent respondents have no preference","Peckham town centre terminus\u003cbr /\u003eOption 1 - via Clayton Road and terminating opposite Peckham Rye rail station\u003cbr /\u003eOption 2 - via Cerise Road and terminating close to the cinema\u003cbr /\u003e44 per cent of respondents prefer route option 2\u003cbr /\u003e32 per cent prefer option 1\u003cbr /\u003e23 per cent have no preference"]}
